basically teased me with a new feature pop up then afterward it’s like “Hey this is the dingus we got to click the shiny button!”

followup idea to the main nav opt in thing - it’d be nice if you guys had a way to do betas that were user account based as well as portal based. - for example the main nav - really only needs to be user based I should be able to opt in and see that nav on all the portals I use since that change doesn’t affect any functionality just navigation.

stuff like Design Manager 2 should stay portal based, where the whole portal opts in and out

This not only lets users get used to a change like the nav at their own pace, but prevents the awkard conversation of “why did you need to enable this feature causing everyone on this portal to get a notification?” - when my thinking was ” oh it’s just the main nav” this is pretty harmless
We're actively discussing keyboard shortcuts. No promises, but its definitely something we've heard from power users like you!

Great feedback Jon. We tried to call out in the opt-in notification (and the post-opt-in messaging) that it would switch the whole portal over, and in testing found that folks preferred knowing that someone at the company had changed it over for them.

What could we change here to help make the account-wide effect clearer?

Once again -- love the feedback, keep it coming. We would love to offer a user-based opt-in option but had some constraints that forced us down the account-wide path. As we expect this to be in an opt-in beta for a while, we will explore other ways to make this work on a per-user basis.
I love the idea of more navigation results showing in search. I'll make sure the search team gets this feedback, and I know it's on their minds already.
